content.text: While the kube RBAC proxy image tag is configurable and can be changed to an up to date version easily, we should provide the latest version in the default values because Artifact Hub reports a vulnerability on the current tag we use

fields.summary: default image tag for Kube RBAC proxy should be upgraded

customfield_10020.name: GKO Sprint 59
customfield_10020.goal: Wrap up the K8s deployment research, and kick-off CRD validation !

nonEditableReason.message: Le lien parent est uniquement disponible pour les utilisateurs Jira Premium.

content.text: Image pull policy should be configurable both for the rbac proxy and the manager container, and default to IfNotPresent as the default setup uses the release image that will never be mutated.

fields.summary: make image pull policies configurable in helm chart

fields.summary: Import an exported V2 API CRD

issuetype.description: This is the Xray Test Issue Type. Used to define test cases of different types that can be executed multiple times using Test Execution issues.
issuetype.name: Test

content.text: When I export a v2 API in the UI (console) as CRD then it’s not possible to re-import that yaml file, it needs to be modified first because there’s a `status` field under the endpoint configuration that is pointed out as unknown when doing a `kubectl apply`. After removing that status field (`status: "UP"`) the deployment succeeds. The attachment shows the exported file in which I deactivated that status field to make the import work.

`Error from server (BadRequest): error when creating "/Users/christian.tschacher/Downloads/ct-export-test-v2-1-crd.yml": ApiDefinition in version "v1alpha1" cannot be handled as a ApiDefinition: strict decoding error: unknown field "spec.proxy.groups[0].endpoints[0].status"`

fields.summary: v2 API exported as CRD can't be re-imported due to unknown field status

content.text: The documentation for v4 APIs is not fully read-only. When you click on the name of custom pages you can still edit the text field and also toggle between private and public.
The changes however can not be saved or published, so this doesn't has any impact and is thus more an improvement recommendation.

content.text: While I tried to verify whether I can successfully update some details in the entrypoint configuration, I noticed that the details of the API entrypoint configuration are not accessible for the user.
In comparison, it looks better for the endpoint configuration where I can access it (read-only) by clicking the eye icon:

fields.summary: Details of entrypoint configuration not accessible
